formElement.label: Command To Use
formElement.documentation: The weblogic.Deployer command to use. i.e: '-deploy', '-undeploy', '-stop' or '-listapps'.

formElement.label: Configuration Name
formElement.documentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration. To view or create a new configuration, go to the Administration -> Plugins tab, and select 'Configure' action for @PLUGIN_KEY@ plugin.
formElement.htmlDocumentation: Name of the configuration to be used. URL, port and credentials are retrieved from the given configuration.

formElement.label: Additional Commands
formElement.documentation: Additional commands to be entered for weblogic.Deployer.

formElement.label: Java Absolute Path
formElement.documentation: Absolute path of java. i.e: 'java', 'java.exe' or '/path/to/java'.

formElement.label: Application Name
formElement.documentation: Name of the application to manage. i.e: 'webapp'.

formElement.label: setDomainEnv Script Absolute Path
formElement.documentation: Absolute path of the setDomainEnv script, including filename and extension. i.e: '/path/to/setDomainEnv.sh' or 'setDomainEnv.cmd'.

formElement.label: weblogic jar Absolute Path
formElement.documentation: Absolute path of the weblogic jar, needed to run the weblogic.Deployer in a free-mode. In Windows environment, if the jar is already added to the enviroment classpath variable, then is not necesary to include it. In Linux environment you must include the path. i.e: '/path/to/weblogic.jar' or '/root/Oracle/Middleware/wlserver_10.3/server/lib/weblogic.jar'.
